alert.note: Alert for Camden (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 08 at 1:28PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southern New Jersey...and southeast Pennsylvania...including the following counties...in southern New Jersey...Camden. In southeast Pennsylvania...Philadelphia. * WHEN...Until 430 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 126 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly across portions of the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Philadelphia, Camden, Palmyra, Wissinoming, Tacony, Golden Triangle, Cherry Hill Mall, Pennsauken, Collingswood, Merchantville, and Woodlynne. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 24 and 29. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
